statement.p: Explain why the vector \left[\begin{array}{c} -5 \\ -10 \\ -3 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] is or is not a linear combination of the vectors \left[\begin{array}{c} -5 \\ 2 \\ -5 \\ 2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} -4 \\ -3 \\ -3 \\ 2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 2 \\ 1 \\ -2 \\ -3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} -10 \\ 4 \\ -10 \\ 4 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{c} 6 \\ -6 \\ 14 \\ 2 \end{array}\right].

answer.p: \left[\begin{array}{c} -5 \\ -10 \\ -3 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] is not a linear combination of the vectors \left[\begin{array}{c} -5 \\ 2 \\ -5 \\ 2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} -4 \\ -3 \\ -3 \\ 2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 2 \\ 1 \\ -2 \\ -3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} -10 \\ 4 \\ -10 \\ 4 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{c} 6 \\ -6 \\ 14 \\ 2 \end{array}\right].
